item.title: Report E-2024070484
item.description:
Report E-2024070484

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifteen (15) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to falling freight that punctured the drum resulting in the released material impacting the trailer floor. Dayton Freight cleaned the impacted area and containerized the recovered clean-up material into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was overpacked. The generated waste was staged at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • City: INDEPENDENCE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was brought to QA department for a tape up due to the bottom being belt burned and tape coming undone by someone other than a QA admin. Package was sat upside down on a metal cart and was later found to have leaked and damaged the top of the top of the package.

item.title: Report E-2024070451
item.description:
Report E-2024070451

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal jerrycans. The released material impacted the trailer floor and Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent absorbents were recovered and containerized into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
